description: From Middle English unbarren, equivalent to un- +â€Ž bar.

verbs.description: unbar (third-person singular simple present unbars, present participle unbarring, simple past and past participle unbarred)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To unlock or unbolt a door that had been locked or bolted with a bar.
(transitive) To remove an impediment that obstructs the passage of (someone or something).
